intro: Hieraciodes columnae, commonly known as the columnar hieracium, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is distinguished by its tall, upright growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers typically bloom in shades of yellow to orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
